page.title: 11INLAND WATER -S. OF BARRHEAD
page.content:
The area is known for its{reservoirs} and{dams}ranging from small ponds to large inland lochs created by manmade dams.
In{most dams}can be found alder and caddis fly larvae, flat worm, fresh water cockle, limpet and shrimp, water beetle, cricket, louse, mite, snail and worm, mayfly and stonefly nymphs pond skater, leech and lesser water boatman. { {Larger dams}contain pike, perch and trout. Some dams are stocked with trout to provide the good angling which is pursued on most of the dams often controlled by resident clubs.
The{waters}also provide a{habitat}for a wide variety of water and wading birds both resident and migratory.
